name: pascal
text: Frankly, I don't see that there are any other viable options.

name: falseprophet
text: I think maybe Ultra Peanut has been a bad influence on him.

name: litfanbreastman
text: Chubbied for the subtle xenophobia implicit in that statement.

name: wolfslice
text: ...Philippe's eyes in panel 3...

name: sargasm
text: Jesus, you're right!  GOD there is so much going on there.

name: tellumo
text: I think that's the only time any Achewood character has had such eyes.

name: spectre
text: Except Robert Johnson, Ray with Robert Johnson and that creepy guy -- mad scientist -- who did the mindwipe on Bensington Butters III

name: straw
text:
Can't you
SEE?

name: stuart
text: Add John and Deanster as well.

name: jesler729
text: Roast Beef drew some on while in the 1978 Volvo 244GLE Of Despair.

name: aperson
text: A comment left by aperson was marked lame too many times and excluded. (marked lame by Overmedicated, NeoNaoNeo, solobuttons, equinn2006, Darthemed)

name: peterjoel
text: Oh, hee hee hee! Hee hee! Oh, hee hee hee!

name: tripleg
text: ...Philippe's eyes and the flipper flab in panel 3...

name: redheron
text: It reminds me of what a startled baby looks like. All wide-eyed and trembling a little, with no idea what to do.

name: heccibiggs
text: I cannot stop laughing.

name: centipede_damascus
text: Phillipe could open a lemonade stand to earn some money. Yet he's so eager to commit suicide.

name: edwell
text: He tried that, once. Pat had him shut down for not obtaining a business license.

name: greyfield
text:
The first time I read this, I thought, "why would you need a business license to commit suicide?"

I mean, Pat's a dick, but...

name: gompo
text: Phillipe thinks about suicide a lot.  Maybe Roast Beef is rubbing off on him.

name: godfatherofsouls
text: They do work on the same newspaper

name: shmuckeles
text: he is five!

name: bluemoon72
text: This happens.  Japan leads the pack for five-year-old suicides.

name: vonpokemon
text: A fine solution to an otherwise impassable obstacle.

name: deancain29
text: A comment left by deancain29 was marked lame too many times and excluded. (marked lame by tekende, Overmedicated, NeoNaoNeo, rowboat, Firehawk, Johnfen, lux, Wolfslice, teenheat, stoned_lightning, Mastronaut, Crimson_King)

name: 1000hz
text: Ray is a stern businessman, cold asking for 3 half-Gs from a boy who is five.

name: cpnglxynchos
text: a six...teen-hundo, if you will.

name: mike24
text: woah, this stip is kinda messed up.  phillipe's eyes really threw me off

name: shoinan
text: It's not like Ray needs the money. He just enjoys the power.

name: philosophe
text: At this point, he hasn't made his money. He gets his cash from his demonic piano skills and an old porno daguerrotype that he sells on eBay.

name: tekende
text: He didn't sell the porn on ebay. He bought it on ebay.

name: lucid
text:
And really, it was never explicitly mentioned that he actually sold it, just how much it would fetch at auction.
Considering the amount of impulse buying Ray does on eBay and the fact there's never been any sign that he's ever even needed any more money since Ass In Your Pants, I never made the assumption that he actually sold the daguerrotype.

Was he a breast man before or after that, anyway? He did mention that the lady was about to be spanked and so it may be worth more to certain...

name: spectre
text: Alt text: "collection agencies on the mind"

name: cdl146
text: "Wait a minute, I have no way of every getting any money." The thoughts of a liberal arts major recently graduated from college.

name: dropkickpikachu
text:
And of course the inevitable, but perfectly logical, thoughts that follow.


:(

name: history
text: It is both the funniest and saddest thing that the fantastic life lessons and learning from literature and history have no impact whatsoever on your ability to make money and provide for a family.

name: zoe
text: Phillipe doesn't have a lot of options

name: quantumcasaba
text:
This also happens when you have no health insurance.
Who understands Philippe?
Me.
(I do)

name: rowboat
text:
Ray symbolizes the gas company in my life right now. Philippe is the little voice that I can wash away with booze.
Me.
(I do)

name: xerol
text: No one's noticed that Ray asks him for the MINIMUM he can pay?

name: em2
text: THESE EYES!

name: cinderfella
text: I like like that Philippe specifically considers committing suicide . There are so few things in this world to commit. Adultery is one. To the Lord Buddha is probably the only other one that I can think of right now.

name: foetus_punch
text: So you think he should have just thought "I should commit"? Maybe I don't understand, but that's what I'm hearing.

name: xiaomimi
text: Maybe he meant to italicize "commit"?

name: nymphadoria
text: Suicide is a viable option

name: gussiejives
text: Suicide: it just makes sense.

name: em2
text: ...it's painless, it brings on many changes; and I can take or leave it as I please.

name: boredom_man
text: But "Suicide: Don't Do It" by Big Fun is one of the most popular songs among teenagers in America today.

name: charchar
text: Something in his head-voice tells me Phillipe thinks that "to commit suicide" is akin to "to take a long trip far away" or "a peaceful nap." (lies my mother told me.)

name: kelsotimebomb
text:
Those are some pretty contrived maternal lies.

Props to your mom!

name: steerpike66
text: Talk to your provider for options on possible suicide. Please Hold.

name: epicurus
text: The last four panels basically sum up my credit history except it takes place in a gym not Ray's house.

name: rbisme
text: my heart lurched in the last panel

name: rykan
text: A 5 from me JUST for Philippe's spong in panel 3.

name: mikeronomicon
text: Nooooooooooooooooooooooo! We love you Philipe!

name: sal
text: This is perhaps the best strip.

name: ghost_story
text: the only time philippe's eyes are not lines ^__^

name: litfanbreastman
text:
I love strips where the punchline is a decision or expressed desire to commit suicide.
This is the other one:
http://m.assetbar.com/achewood/uua5sRcB1

name: lungfish
text: Is it wrong that it makes me happy to imagine a five year old contemplating suicide for financial reasons?
